Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Beautiful \Beau"ti*ful\ (b[=u]"t[i^]*f[.u]l), a. Having the qualities which constitute beauty; pleasing to the sight or the mind. [1913 Webster]
A circle is more beautiful than a square; a square is more beautiful than a parallelogram. --Lord Kames. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Handsome; elegant; lovely; fair; charming; graceful; pretty; delightful. See {Fine}. -- {Beau"ti*ful*ly}, adv. -- {Beau"ti*ful*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]
beautifully adv : in a beautiful manner; "her face was beautifully made up" [syn: {attractively}] [ant: {unattractively}]
